events.message: The insured reported a car collision that happened at an intersection causing moderate damage to the front bumper and hood.
The claim was identified as an auto accident due to keywords such as car, collision, and accident in the report.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to handle the vehicle accident claim, allowing quick and focused assistance.
The claim was officially acknowledged by the insurance company and confirmation sent to the claimant.
Request sent for police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates to proceed with claim investigation.
Claimant submitted all requested documentation including signed police report and three repair shop estimates.
Investigation began to verify the accident circumstances and assess damage against submitted documents.
Investigation confirmed the accident claim details and determined that the damages are covered as per policy.
A settlement offer was proposed to the insured based on repair costs and coverage limits detailed in policy.
Customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and requested immediate disbursement for repairs.
The claim was officially approved by the claims manager after final review of all documents and investigation.
Insurance payment was issued electronically to the claimantâ€™s account to cover the agreed repair costs.
The claim was formally closed after confirming that the insured received payment and repairs were scheduled.
All claim documentation and records were archived securely for future reference and regulatory compliance.
